timeline.title: Agreement Effective Date
timeline.description: Agreement takes effect contingent upon prior approval by COMMISSION governing board. CONSULTANT commences work after notification to proceed by COMMISSION's Contract Manager.

timeline.title: First Progress Report and Invoice Submission
timeline.description: CONSULTANT must submit written progress report with first invoice within 45 days of work performance. Invoice must include detailed labor, expenses, and completion percentages.

timeline.title: Mid-Term Insurance Certificate Renewal
timeline.description: CONSULTANT must provide updated Certificates of Insurance if coverage expires during term, with at least 30 days' prior notice to COMMISSION.

timeline.title: Final Deliverable Submission
timeline.description: CONSULTANT submits all deliverables for acceptance by Contract Manager. Final invoice must be submitted within 60 days after acceptance.

timeline.title: Agreement End Date
timeline.description: Agreement ends as per term, unless terminated earlier or extended by amendment. All records must be maintained for 5 years post final payment.

penalty_forecast.description: Penalty for unauthorized personnel change or subcontracting

narratives.title: Late Invoice Submission
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT fails to submit invoice within 45 days
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT performs work in June but delays invoice submission until August. COMMISSION delays payment and issues a warning. Repeated delays may lead to termination for default under Section 4.B, triggering reprocurement costs and penalties.
narratives.financial_impact: ₹10000 penalty plus interest on delayed payment

narratives.title: Unauthorized Subcontracting
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT subcontracts work without prior written approval
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT engages a subconsultant for a ₹60000 task without COMMISSION approval. COMMISSION discovers this during an audit and terminates the agreement for default. CONSULTANT is liable for reprocurement costs of ₹100000 and loses future contracting opportunities.

narratives.title: Insurance Lapse
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT fails to maintain required insurance coverage
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT's general liability insurance expires in December 2024 without renewal. COMMISSION issues a 10-day notice to cure under Section 6.B.5. Failure to comply leads to termination for default, exposing CONSULTANT to indemnification claims and legal liabilities.
narratives.financial_impact: ₹50000 in potential penalties and uncovered claims

risk_alerts.message: Failure to maintain insurance coverage as per Section 6 may result in immediate termination and significant financial liabilities.
Unauthorized changes to key personnel or subcontractors without prior written approval from COMMISSION can lead to default termination.
Delays in invoice submission beyond 45 days may incur penalties and payment delays, affecting cash flow.
